meanings.definition: A target for throwing stones or other objects.
meanings.sent1: The scarecrow in the field served as a cockshy for the mischievous children.
meanings.sent2: The old tin can hanging from the tree was used as a cockshy by the kids.
meanings.sent3: The cockshy in the carnival game was a rubber duck that kept moving.
meanings.sent4: The bull's-eye on the archery target became a cockshy for the skilled archer.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons at the fair were set up as cockshies for the dart game.

meanings.definition: To throw stones or other objects at a target.
meanings.sent1: The naughty boy decided to cockshy at the cans lined up on the fence.
meanings.sent2: During the game, the players would cockshy at the bottles to knock them down.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to cockshy acorns at the unsuspecting birds.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to cockshy her worries away by throwing pebbles into the pond.
meanings.sent5: The kids would cockshy pebbles at the pond, trying to make them skip as many times as possible.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is the object of criticism or ridicule.
meanings.sent1: The new student became the cockshy of the class bullies.
meanings.sent2: The unpopular teacher was often the cockshy of the school gossip.
meanings.sent3: The comedian made the mayor the cockshy of his jokes during the show.
meanings.sent4: The old statue in the park had become a cockshy for its outdated design.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out shoes were the cockshy of her friends' teasing.
